page.title: 02LOCAL GOVERNMENT WASHINGTON
page.content: Washington{Development Corporation was set up by central government in 1964 for the New Town; however, work did not begin until 1965. Its headquarters is at{Usworth Hall,}an historic building formerly belonging to the National Coal Board. Its main aims were to create{jobs, build industrial estates to lure{new {industry}into the area and raise the standard of the urban{environment}e.g. by planting trees, building new houses. It differs from the council as it is not a permanent organisation. The Corporation{employs}240 people from clerks to manual workers and operates like a miniature government. In 1986 the Corporation will close down and 90 of its employees will be transferred to Sunderland Council.
